titleStmt.title: By the King and Queens Authority. At the Angel and Ball, within three doors of St. Clements Church in the Strand, near Temple-Bar. These are to give notice, that here is lately arrived an experienced and most famous High-German doctor, who by his great study, and constant practice in several parts of the world, as well in princes courts as in hospitals, and war-like expeditions, hath obtained such a physical method, as to cure all external and internal distempers (if curable,) ...

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 11KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 2 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal licence. The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: By the King and Queens Authority. At the Angel and Ball, within three doors of St. Clements Church in the Strand, near Temple-Bar. These are to give notice, that here is lately arrived an experienced and most famous High-German doctor, who by his great study, and constant practice in several parts of the world, as well in princes courts as in hospitals, and war-like expeditions, hath obtained such a physical method, as to cure all external and internal distempers (if curable,) ...

notesStmt.note: Imprint from Wing. Wing gives two imprint dates, 1689 and 1694. Cataloger surmises publication date from the order in which items are bound.
MS. notation suggests that E8:1[104] is a duplicate of E8:1[3].
Title take from caption and first lines of text.
With a woodcut of an angel being crowned by two cherubs. Framing the illustration is the sentence: "At the Angel and Ball, within Three Doors.
Item at reel E8:1[3] imperfect: torn at foot, with some loss of text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).

Full documentation of the original data capture process is available from the Text Creation Partnership web site. All versions of the texts are now archived and freely available for download. See the TCP Download FAQ for detailed information. The TEI P5 versions are also freely available from the TCP Github repository.

revisionDesc.change: 2014-02 SPi GlobalKeyed and coded from ProQuest page images
2014-08 Colm MacCrossanText and markup reviewed and edited

div.p: By the KING and QUEENS Authority.

figure.figDesc: depiction of an angel blowing a trumpet or horn, being crowned by two other angels

div.p: At the Angel and Ball, within Three Doors of St. Clements Church in the Strand near Temple-Bar.

THese are to give Notice, That here is Arrived an Experienced and most Famous High-German Doctor, who by his great Study, and constant Practice in several Parts of the World, as well in Princes Courts, as in Hospitals, and War-like Expeditions, hath obtained such a Physical Method, as to Cure all external and internal Distempers (if Curable,) and a great many he has cured when left off by others as incurable; as he can shew by Testimonials not only from Emperors, Kings, Dukes, and Electoral Princes, but also from the Right Honourable the Lord Mayor of London, with the Court of Aldermen. Also from the Right Worshipful Mayor and Aldermen of the City of Bristol, Worcester and Hereford, &c. and many other Cities and Corporations in this Kingdom, certifying the great, many, speedy, and wonderful Cures he has undertaken, and (by Gods Blessing) most happily performed.

2. He lets you understand, that he is so Famous an Oculist, as also so excellent in Curing the Stone and Rupture, that the like of him is scarce to be found. If any Patients come which are troubled with Blindness of the Eyes by Gataracts, he restores their sight in less than a quarter of an hour, and makes them perfectly to see in 8 or 9 days time, if they have been Blind 10, 15, or 20 years, if Curable: He has by the Blessing of God cured several Hundreds: He has Cured those that were Born Blind (by Cataracts.) He cureth also Obstructions, Suffusions, Dimness, or Darkness in the Eyes, all Pearls, Pins, Webs, and skins of all kinds growing on, or setled on the Eyes, as also Redness, Hotness, or running of the Eyes, or any other Distemper of the Eyes which is not here mentioned, he cures to Admiration in a very short time.

3. Such People as are troubled with that intolerable pain of the Stone in the Bladder (in making water) he cures the same dexterously (after all other means unprofitably used) by Cutting, or without; in a few days by a new and easie method: He can also take the Stone out of the Bladder of Women or Maids without Cutting, per dilattationem.

4. He helps also all Bursten or Broken Bellies, either in Men, Women or Children, whether the Rupture be in the Groin or Navel; and if the Rupture be as big as a Mans Head, then trust to God and his Art, and you shall have your Cure, that you may go about in a short time without a Truss, if you have been Bursten 20 or 30 years together. He also directeth Artificially all sorts of Trusses, so easie the like was never seen, the Patient may go in the same, and Ride, Dance and Spring, and do what they will without any Danger, which Medicine healeth artificially under the same. Of these Ruptures are found seven sorts, Hernia Intestinalis, Ventosa, Varicosa, Aq • osa, Carnosa, Humoralis, Exomphalis; all these this famous Doctor can help in a short time, either by Cutting or without Cutting, as he finds the Patient: And those Patients that desire to be Cured with Cutting, he will undertake to Cure them artificially, without any Danger in 14 days, and others without Cutting in 6 or 8 weeks.

5. He also Cures Hair Lips, Wry Necks, all sorts of Ulcers, great Wens, Cancers in the Lips, Tongue, or Breast, the Rickets in Children, Crooked Legs, Fistula's either in Arms, Legs, Eyes, &c. in a short time.

6. This Doctor hath a most rare way for the curing of the Kings-Evil, and Falling-Sickness in Men, Women, and Children, if they have been troubled with it 10, or 20 years, so that they shall not be troubled with it again all their Life-time.

7. He likewise cureth Women and Maids of many Infirmities, as, The Green-Sickness, Stoppage or Overflowing of the Courses of Nature. He also helps the Whites and Weakness of the Back, and other Distempers of Women. He hath a great Secret to help Conception; likewise a powerful Medicine to prevent Miscarriage, although you have Miscarried five or six times successively.

8. This Doctor cureth in an extraordinary, and most easie manner the Morbus Gallicus, or French-POX with all its Symptoms, (as the Gonorrhea, or Running of the Reins, Shankers, Buboes, or Swellings in the Groin, pain in the Head, Arms, Shoulders
and Legs, or Ulcers in the Mouth, Throat, Scabs, Itch, and breaking out over the whole Body) after a new and easie method, although you have had it several years, and have been Fluxt several times, and almost spoiled by others, and given over as incurable; he can Cure you both surely and safely, without either Fluxing or Mercury, or any Danger at all; he has Cured many when left off by other Doctors as incurable: Therefore those who have met with a CLAP, or Running of the Reins, he promises to Cure them perfectly; not by Astringents, but by rooting out the Malignity, and by gentle Healing Means; in 6 or 7 days time, as abundance an Witness of both Sexes: or else desires nothing for his Pains, which is as much as to say NO CURE NO MONEY.

9. He cureth artificially all Distempers in Men or Women, as Vapours, Giddiness, or Swimming of the Head, or any Fainting Fits, Noise of the Head, Deafness; also the Dropsie, Yellow-Jaundice, Scurvy, Rheumanism, Cold and Phlegmatick Stomach, Windy and tedious Coughs, spitting of Blood, Ptisick, Consumption, stoppage of the Liver, hardness of the Spleen, overflowing of the Gall, Melancholy, Madness, Small-Pox, Agues, Fevers, Pleurisies, Wind and Cholick, Worms in Children or Old People, all Pain or Aches of the Limbs, or any part of the Body, Lameness, Shrinking or Coutraction of the Nerves or Sinews; Bloody-Flux, stoppage of the Urine, or such as cannot hold their Water, or pains in making Water, voiding of Blood, Ulcers in the Womb and Bladder: And many other Distempers which no Physician can give Name to; he hath Cured such, when given over by others as incurable.

10. He would have no person despair by reason of the long continuance of their Distemper; but bring their Urine and he will give his Judgment in all Distempers, and resolve you whether your Disease be Curable or not; if Curable, he will undertake them; if not, he tells you so, that you may not be abused by False Pretenders; and will give you such satisfaction that you may see what an honest Physician for Counsel and Physick can perform.

11. He keeps likewise an Operator that cleanses the Teeth and makes them as white as Ivory, and extracts Aching Teeth with a Touch, and gives present ease to those pained with hollow Teeth, and takes all the Scorbutical Humours out of the Gums, and fastens loose Teeth.
For the Satisfaction of the Curious, shall be inserted only some few notable Cures (out of the many Hundreds might be mentioned) which have been wrought by this Famous High-German Doctor lately.

HE Cured Mr. William St. John, Son of Sir Walter St. John, at Battersea, of a most Violent Bloody Flux; after he had been in the Hands of the most Able Physicians about London near Two Years, and given over by all of them as Incurable, was Cured by him in Eight Weeks time.

He Cured Jos. Foster, at the Sugar-loaf, at the Corner of Rose-lane in Winford-street, near Spittle-fields, aged 37 years; he could not See in all his Life; 15 years since he was in the hands of other Doctors, but without any success. He was restored to his Sight in 9 days time, to the Admiration of all that knew him.

Mrs. King, at the Kings Arms near Holbourn Bridge was Cured of a violent Rheum and Redness in her Eyes, with Terrible Pains; after she had tryed for some years all manner of Medicines which the best Physicians could prescribe, was Cured by him in a Fortnights time, with several others thereabouts.

Mrs. Taylor, of Fulham Parish, Aged 72, was Blind of One Eye 6 years, of the other 3 years, was Cured by him in a Fortnights time. This Cure was performed at Mr. Roses House, a Hat-Dyer, in Bride-Lane.

He Cured the Son of Mr. Dunckerly, living in Kings-street, over against the Sun, the back-side of Grafton-street, in St. Anns Parish. He was troubled with the Stone almost ever since he was Born, he Cut him and took away the Stone, which was as big as an Egg, & cured him in the space of between 3 or 4 Weeks.

Mr. Edward Cooke, near Marigold-stairs in Southwark having had a Cancer in his Lip 4 years, and been 3 years under the hands of many Eminent Physicians and Chirurgions in and about this City, was perfectly Cured by this Famous Doctor in the space of 10 days.

He also Cured Mr. Richard Catley of Cold Harbor, in the Parish of Shoreditch, of a Cancer in the Lip, when he had been 5 or 6 years in several other Physicians hands, and all to no purpose, was Cured by him in a Weeks time. Also his next Neighbour Mr. John Griffin was Cured at the same time of a deep Consumption of a long continuance.

Mr. Scot in Newport Market, who was given over for a Dead Man of the Ptifick, he was stopt up insomuch that he could hardly fetch any Breath, and every minute thought he should Breath his last, he was by Gods Blessing perfectly Cured in the space of 3 weeks.

Mr. Parsons, at the Kings Yard in Deptford, was troubled with the Evil in his Throat, and a deep Consumption, he had been with several Physitians for help, yet grew worse & worse, he was cured in less than 4 weeks.

☞ This Famous High-German Doctor is now for the Publick Good setled in the Strand, at the Angel and Ball, between Temple-Bar and St. Clements Church; just over against the Golden Spectacles, the third Door from St. Clements Church, on the same side of the way; where the Pictures of Patients, and Manual Operations are over the Door. And is to be spoke with from 8 in the morning till 11, and from 1 till 9 at night.
